comment: Warm maple sugar nose and taste. Copper and corn and toasted oak leather with slight spice

66.7% That's pretty hot! Smelling this reminds me of walking through a lumber yard. Dried white oak, not the bark but the center. upon tasting, I got the sense of vanilla on the winglets of my tongue. mid and back palate draw smooth spice and an inoffensive finish. maybe the finish could be longer, but I like it week-long anyways.
Sweet oak nose, very rich initially with warm vanilla and sugar followed by wheat bread, more oak notes on finish, drinks much smoother than proof
This is delicious, easy to drink despite the high proof
Hot as fu#k! Great nose, sweet vanilla cornbread and oak. Palette gets smoked by the heat and I drink exclusively BP Bourbon.
Slightly more smooth than the Texas Straight. Less spice in the barrel strength.
